byline.original: By SHARON LAFRANIERE, MICHAEL WINES and EDWARD WONG
byline.contributor: Li Bibo and Edy Yin contributed research, and Jonathan Ansfield contributed reporting.

abstract: Chinese authorities are proposing new limits on media and Internet freedoms that include some of the most restrictive measures in years; the crackdown coincides with a planned shift in the top leadership of the ruling party and follows popular uprisings across the Middle East and North Africa that have created unease among the country's leaders.
snippet: Communist leaders are proposing some of the tightest limits on media and Internet freedoms in years.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

lead_paragraph: Communist leaders are proposing some of the tightest limits on media and Internet freedoms in years.

headline.main: China Reins In Entertainment and Blogging
headline.print_headline: China Reins In Entertainment And Blogging
headline.seo: China Proposes New Curbs on Entertainment and Bloggers
